author: Lizzie Dearden
title: Refugees freezing to death as boat crossings continue into winter
description: Refugees are dying of hypothermia as thousands continue desperate attempts to cross the Mediterranean Sea in plummeting temperatures and worsening winter weather. While European leaders have hailed the “success” of a deal aiming to stop migrant boats being launched from Turkey to Greece, the number of asylum seekers taking the longer and more treacherous route from Libya to Italy has increased dramatically.

title: Donald Trump will keep his executive producer role on "Celebrity Apprentice"
description: Donald Trump will keep his executive producer credit on NBC’s Celebrity Apprentice throughout his presidency,” production studio MGM confirmed to Variety on Thursday night.

author: Feliks Garcia
title: Hillary Clinton says fake news is a 'dangerous epidemic' that puts lives at risk
description: Hillary Clinton spoke out against the proliferation of “fake news and false propaganda”, and called on leaders from all political parties to act that she says threatens American lives.  Speaking at a tribute in honour of Senate Minority Leader Harry Reid, who retired on Thursday, Ms Clinton took the opportunity to call on leaders in the public and private sectors to quell the “epidemic” of fake news.

author: Siobhan Fenton
title: MPs' vote to back Theresa May's Brexit plans 'was not legally binding'
description: A vote by MPs to back Theresa May’s Brexit plans was not legally binding, the Government’s lawyers have admitted. James Eadie QC made the concession during the final day of Supreme Court appeal which is considering whether the Prime Minister has sufficient authority to trigger Article 50 without a vote by MPs.

author: Lizzie Dearden
title: Magnitude 7.8 earthquake hits Solomon Islands
description: A magnitude 7.8 earthquake has struck the Solomon Islands, sparking a warning for "hazardous tsunami waves" that was later lifted. The quake hit shortly after 4.38am local time on Friday (5.30pm GMT) and was followed by four aftershocks, with the epicentre recorded off the coast of Makira island at a depth of 30 miles (48.7km). Phone lines were down and electricity cuts reported in some areas but there were no immediate reports of casualties or major damage.

author: Rachael Revesz
title: The first woman on a Canadian $10 bank note is black activist Viola Desmond
description: First Jane Austen, then Harriet Tubman, and now Viola Desmond. While it may have been a questionable year for the advancement of women’s rights, it has been a progressive few years in terms of legendary female figures on bank notes. Canada has announced that the first woman to grace its C$10 bill in 2018 will be Viola Desmond, a black woman from Nova Scotia who challenged racial segregation at a cinema in New Glasgow in 1946.

author: Rachael Revesz
title: The fast food CEO who does not want to raise the minimum wage is likely labour secretary
description: Donald Trump continues to fill his cabinet with corporate powers, and the latest is the appointment of a fast food chief executive officer as labour secretary. Andy Puzder is CEO of CKE Restaurants Holdings Inc, which is the parent company of Carl’s Jr and Hardee’s burger chains. The fast food industry represents 10 per cent of American workers, in a country where more than 42 million Americans live in “food insecure” households.

author: Rachael Revesz
title: Black man tied to chair by police and beaten so badly he goes blind
description: A black man in Michigan has filed a lawsuit against his local police department after he was beaten by police so badly that he lost vision in one eye. Frankie Taylor was arrested for alleged drink driving on 10 August last year. He was taken to the police station, restrained, tied to a chair and savagely beaten. The disturbing incident at Eastpointe police department was caught on camera. The footage was obtained by Fox News.

author: Feliks Garcia
title: John Glenn, pioneer astronaut and US senator, dies at 95
description: John Glenn, the American space pioneer and former US senator, has died. He was 95 years old.  Sen Glenn died on Thursday afternoon at the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Centre in Columbus. He is survived by his wife of 73 years, Annie.

author: talkSPORT
title: Zorya Luhansk 0-2 Manchester United: Red Devils stars rated and slated
description: Manchester United secured their place in the Europa League last 32 with a drab 2-0 win over Ukrainian side Zorya Luhansk on Thursday evening. Henrikh Mkhitaryan scored three minutes into the second half to open the scoring, with Zlatan Ibrahimovic securing all three points in the dying stages, sending the Red Devils through to the knockout stage as Group A runners up. It was not a vintage United performance by any means, with Jose Mourinho's men slow in possession and lacking in cutting edge, but grinding out the win was all that mattered.

author: talkSPORT
title: Southampton 1-1 Hapoel Be'er Sheva: Saints knocked out after score draw
description: Toothless Southampton bungled the chance for their best continental run since 1977 after Israeli minnows Hapoel Be'er Sheva forced a 1-1 Europa League draw at St Mary's. The limp hosts only needed a goalless draw to progress to the last 32 of Europe's second-tier competition, but Oriol Romeu's mistake let Hapoel progress instead. Forward Maor Buzaglo angled home the vital goal that guided Hapoel to the knockout stages in their very first Europa League campaign.

author: talkSPORT
title: LISTEN: Jose Mourinho explains Henrikh Mkhitaryan’s good form - ‘He fought to improve tactically and physically’
description: Henrikh Mkhitaryan has been praised for his tactical and physical improvement by Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho. Mkhitaryan, who was signed over the summer from Borussia Dortmund, made just his fifth start of the season on Thursday evening, putting in a scintillating showing in a 2-0 Europa League win over Zorya Luhansk. The Armenian opened the scoring three minutes into the second half with an excellent run through the middle of the park, and was the centre of all United's good work in what was an otherwise poor performance from the Red Devils.

author: talkSPORT
title: Leeds United owner Massimo Cellino banned for 18 months for breaking Football Association agent regulations
description: Leeds owner Massimo Cellino has been banned for 18 months - effective from February 1, 2017 - for breaking the Football Association's agent regulations, the governing body has announced. The suspension prevents the Italian from being either a director or shadow director at any football club, with both him and the club being handed £250,000 fines due to the infraction. Cellino also has to attend and complete an FA education programme 'covering the duties and responsibilities of an owner and director of an English football club' before the end of April 2017.

title: Premier League clubs ranked by most wins at Wembley Stadium (old and new)

Spurs are also planning to play Premier League matches at Wembley in future, as they will have to vacate White Hart Lane in order to complete the construction of their new ground. But Wembley hasn't proved a happy home for Tottenham in Europe, as they lost their first two matches at the stadium and crashed out of the continent's premier competition.
